channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2024040379
item.description:
Report E-2024040379

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding ripped and torn bags of Sodium Nitrate as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. This resulted in approximately 10lbs of product impacting the trailer floor in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and containerized all of the damaged product into two poly drums for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this release.

item.title: Report X-2024040605
item.description:
Report X-2024040605

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found wet during trailer unload. No other packages are known to be affected by the leaks. The package was secured in a plastic-lined tote and removed from the work area. It was placed in the hazmat cage until end of sort when reports are then processed. DescribePack: The package may have been transported on its side. I found two of the three containers with loose caps and small drips escaping from them when placed on their sides. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: We covered the spill area with an absorbent product and swept up the material and removed it away from unloaders and their workspace.

item.title: Report X-2024040421
item.description:
Report X-2024040421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down on the NC belt and leaked on the belt and the floor. Package handler and QA member cleaned Hazmat liquid with absorbent pads in house clear up was successful hazmat was then put in a red lined tote and brought to QA station to do proper hazmat disposal process. DescribePack: broken/loose cap on both bottles. one completely broke off and other bottle just lost its cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: In house clean up. used absorbent pads to clean up spill

item.title: Report X-2024040468
item.description:
Report X-2024040468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: OTTUMWA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was unloading a trailer and spotted a damp package. Package was put into a tote and sent to QA for inspection. During inspection, it was determined the the battery was leaking battery acid. DescribePack: The package seemed to be in good condition with sufficient packing material. This has lead station personnel to believe the battery was compromised before it was picked up. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: the package was put into a tote and the battery was set upright to reduce the leakage.
